level.heading: Annual reporting requirements; submission of plan.

level.text: Beginning on January 15, 1991, and on each January 15th of each subsequent year, the Mayor shall submit a recycling report to the Council for review, which shall contain the following:
The tonnage of solid waste generated, disposed of, and recycled by the District;
An evaluation of the mandatory recycling program established pursuant to this subchapter;
The tonnage of paper collected and recycled from District government offices;
The revenue generated through the disposition of recycled materials for the District;
The approximate cost avoidance achieved through the District's mandatory recycling program;
The overall success of meeting the recovery targets set forth in § 8-1006;
An evaluation of markets for recycled materials and how District policies have stimulated markets;
An evaluation of the educational and promotional campaign on the mandatory source separation program as developed by the District of Columbia Recycling Coordinator pursuant to § 8-1008.
By October 1, 1989, the Mayor shall submit to the Council a plan for the following:
The recovery of tires from the solid waste stream for reuse, recycling, or other disposition;
The segregation, treatment, labeling, tracking, transportation, and disposition of medical, infectious, and hazardous waste;
The recycling and reuse of construction and demolition wastes;
The provision of tax incentives and low interest loans to District businesses and residents that use recycled products or purchase or lease recycling equipment;
The recycling of plastic polystyrene and polyvinyl chloride containers.
